org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.msg
Class HttpSenderHandshakeMessage

java.lang.Object
  org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.msg.SenderHandshakeMessage
      org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.msg.HttpSenderHandshakeMessage

public class HttpSenderHandshakeMessage
extends SenderHandshakeMessage

Class used for handshaking. The handshake parameters are internally handled as String. Thus it's evident to validate the values to have correct lengths and contents using the method isValid(). The HttpSenderHandshakeMessage can handle the HTTP specific additons to the SenderHandshakeMessage, e.g.:

  • access method (POST, GET, ...)
  • vedor-specific parameters in the HTTP header
  • content-length of the message

Author:
Andreas Fürer, ETH Zurich Switzerland, Winter 2005/06

getHeaderField

public java.lang.String getHeaderField(java.lang.String name)
Returns the value to which the specified name is mapped in the HTTP header.

Parameters:
name - A name of a parameter in the header
Returns:
the value to which the name is mapped; null if the parameter doesn't exist.

addHeaderField

public void addHeaderField(java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.String value)
Adds a new value of a HTTP header field into the header map. Use this map for additional or vendor-specific parameters in the HTTP header.

Parameters:
key - The name of the HTTP parameter
value - The value of the HTTP parameter
